dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model

Class Attr

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.Attr

  • public class Attr
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles attribute accessing functions. This class provides the access to AUTOSAR node attributes. The interface IAutosarModelConstants holds static variables that define the attributes that can be obtained by the methods of this class. To be sure, which kind of type an attribute has, the method 
     <b>int</b> getAttributeType( String attributeName )
    can be used. The integer codes can be found in this class as static final variables starting with TYPE_*

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    Since:
    2008.b

      • getType

        public int getType(java.lang.String attrName)
            throws CtxtException
        Returns the type of the named attribute as a bitmask. The type descriptors can be found as public static members in the Attr class.
        Parameters:
        attrName - the name of the attribute
        Returns:
        returns type bitmask or 0 otherwise
        Throws:
        CtxtException
        Since:
        2008.b

                                         java.lang.String path,
                                         int idx,
                                         java.lang.String[] def)
                                  throws CtxtException
        Returns the attribute value with the given name from the current DCtxt
        Parameters:
        attrName - the name of the attribute
        path - The path to the string list
        idx - The index of the variable (counting from 1)
        def - the default value, if attribute is not set or is no String Array
        Returns:
        the values of the attribute or the default values if attribute is not set
        Throws:
        CtxtException
        Since:
        2008.b

        Returns the attribute value with the given name from the current DCtxt
        Parameters:
        attrName - the name of the attribute
        def - the default value, if attribute is not set or is no int
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute or the default value if attribute is not set
        Throws:
        CtxtException
        Since:
        2008.b
